title: So minions are more stronger than players from 1 to lvl 4. What a fkn joke
body: I'm fighting a nasus top i'm riven. My damage trade is more at start before he stacks but i can't seem to do more damage to him than minions do to me like wtf minions carry now like it's not fun what is this game now.

replies.body: so essentially what you should be doing vs nasus is shoving him in early, drawing enemy jg pressure and roaming. dont try to kill nasus because he is tanky and minions do too much damage early. if nasus makes a mistake then fight him but if he is just farming safely then dont.

Also focus on zoning nasus away from your minion if they're pushed closer to your turret, but only as the next wave is coming into the lane and about to hit your wave which will prevent you from taking too much minion damage.
yeah but dont do freeze (freezing is locking the wave near your tower and zoning) if you can 1v2 or jg isnt top because pushing is better.

Minions have always been a deciding factor in winning trades, not just in top lane, but all lanes. You shouldn't be fighting anyone in their minions in the first place. Anyone that knows what they're doing can easily abuse minion damage to win trades. Think about it for a moment, you auto nasus which triggers 3 caster minions for example. Each time those caster minions attack, each caster is doing around 23 damage, 23x3= 69 damage per auto (not factoring in your armour). So almost every second or so you're taking 69 from casters. If your trade goes on for about 5 seconds you're taking 345 damage from minions (Not factoring armour). That amount is going to be even huger if you decide to fight in a cannon wave. So yeah, don't fight in minions.
Their should be a scaling effect with monsters like their is with jg common it's not the same LOL it's just about minions and towers not champion skill
